definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Was very quick and then passed by for a daytime, the Lan Hui also achieved embroidering a sleeves.
sentences.chinese: 一天很快就過去了，瀾惠也繡完了一隻袖子。

sentences.english: She dusted some ash from her sleeve.
Armhole Balance This allows a set-in-sleeve to hang slightly forward and follow the curvature of the arm.
sentences.chinese: 即裝袖後，袖子應稍微前傾，以符合手臂的形狀。

sentences.english: The coat is too tight; it must be eased under the arms.
sentences.chinese: 這件外套太緊了，須在袖子下面放寬鬆點。

sentences.english: Her sleeves are bordered with narrow blue bands.
sentences.chinese: 她的袖子用藍色窄條鑲邊。

sentences.english: I rolled up my sleevesand went back to Lulu.
sentences.chinese: 我捲起袖子，回到露露身邊。

sentences.english: Soapy's elbow was poling through his torn shirt sleeve.
sentences.chinese: 蘇比的胳膊肘從他襯衣的破袖子裏露了出來。

sentences.english: He wears a suit and tie, and a shirt with sleeves that cover his arms.
sentences.chinese: 他穿西裝，打領帶，並支付他的武器與袖子的襯衫。

sentences.english: She tacked the sleeves on and sew them up.
sentences.chinese: 她先用粗針腳縫上袖子，然後再細細縫好。
所以，我挽起袖子開始打鍵盤了。

sentences.english: Then Holly would have opened his throat for him with the knife hidden up her sleeve.
sentences.chinese: 接着霍麗就會用她袖子裏藏着的刀割開他的喉嚨。

sentences.english: First put your arm through the sleeve, now put your head through.
sentences.chinese: 先把你的肐膊伸進袖子，現在把你的腦袋鉆出來。

sentences.english: Look, the sleeves are too long for me. Can you shorten them?
sentences.chinese: 看，這袖子對我來說太長了，你們可以改短嗎？

sentences.english: One of the children was pawing at my sleeve.
sentences.chinese: 有個孩子一個勁地拽我的袖子。

sentences.english: Only the left sleeve of the last one was missing.
sentences.chinese: 六件襯衫已經縫好，只是最後一件左邊還少一隻袖子。

sentences.english: He too would roll up his sleeves and scribble for money.
sentences.chinese: 他也捲起袖子，爲錢亂寫一通。

definition: collar/neckband/neckline/the place where the two ends of a collar meet
the front piece(s) of a Chinese jacket/lapel
